Value cannot be empty! Illegal values. Vehicle length must be greater than or equal to 483 and less than or equal to 32767. Vehicle height and width must be greater than or equal to 483 and less than or equal to 4000. Illegal values. Deviation must be greater than or equal to -250 and less than or equal to 250. Height and depth must be greater than or equal to 100 and less than or equal to 3000.

Adjustment and verification calibrate and fix the main unit Tap the ‘Adjustment’ button to start the road test. 
The road test may last for several minutes. 
 During the test, you can DRIVE or PARK, but must keep your car IN THE MIDDLE of the lane as possible as you can, and must drive straight forward as possible as you can. Warning Settings Warning Sensitivity Set Speed Set Speed (Default 50km/h) (Default 30km/h) (Default 70km/h) There are four grades. Grade 0 means to close the alarms, while grade 1 is ‘least’, grade 2 is ‘medium’, and grade 3 means the ‘most’ sensitive. Lane Departure Warning When your vehicle speed exceeds the Set Speed, the system will warn you before lane departure happens. Forward Collision Warning When your vehicle speed exceeds the Set Speed, the system will warn you before forward collision happens. Pedestrian Collision Warning When your vehicle speed is UNDER the Set Speed, the system will warn you when forward pedestrians are detected.
Forward Collision Warning - FCW 1. Icons on the buzzer Green car: A front vehicle found at safety distance. Red car: A front vehicle found within dangerous distance. Digits: unit in seconds. Also called the TTC (Time To Collision) value. This value means the time in which you will crash into the front vehicle, if that car stops suddenly but you keep your speed. Safe Danger Solid-lines Dotted line 2. Warning methods App setting: Start speed: The speed above which the warning turns on. For example: when it is set at 30KM, if you drive faster than 30KM/h, the FCW function turns on, and if you drive slower than 30KM/h, the system will not alarm for FCW reasons. . Sensitivity: Sensitivity level separates into 4 level: 0,1,2,3. Every level has its warning time. Time is numbers show on buzzer screen. For example: If level 1 is set, when you are going to crash into the front car in 0. 8 minutes if that car stops suddenly, the system will alarm. Alarm sounds "D": general alarm. Alarm sound "DDDD": very dangerous. You are much faster than and getting too close to the front car. Dear user, 

Thanks for choosing Vispect Advanced Driving Assistant System. 

The Installation greatly influences the performance of this system. Please follow the detailed instructions step by step. 

Best wishes

Vispect Team Start
Driving Not connected to device Connect smartphone with your ADAS device? TO Connect Connect TO Disconnect Connect Real-Time Mode Choose Your Device Connect Success No real mode attached to S1 device
Link Off Live
Lane Departure Warning - LDW 1Icons on the buzzer: when the system is just powered on, the buzzer displays gray lanes. Red solid lane: your car is crossing a solid lane and you did not turn on the turn-light. L/R dotted lane: your car is crossing a dotted lane and you did not turn on the turn-light. 1. Warning method: Start speed: The speed above which the warning turns on. For example: when it is set at 30KM, if you drive faster than 30KM/h, the LDW function turns on, and if you drive slower than 30KM/h, the system will not alarm for LDW reasons. Sensitivity: The 0, 1, 2, and 3 levels represent different sensitivities. The system starts alarming if the conditions below are met.
Pedestrian Collision Warning - PCW At speed of 10–60km/h, within 40 meters away from your vehicle, system will give warning of pedestrians, bicycles, electric vehicles and motorcycles in driveway and adjacent lanes.
Virtual Bumpers - VB When vehicle speed is less than 5km/h, the system will warn with "DD" alarm when the distance from the vehicle is less than 3 meters. Remind the driver that the vehicle is too close to the front car.
Front Vehicle Start Alarm - FVSA When the vehicle is in stop status with 0km/h, if the moving distance between your vehicle and front vehicle is more than 5 meters, system will warn to remind the driver that the vehicle can go now.
Icons and Sounds try reading the turn signals by yourself? We do not have the turn signal data of your model. Try reading the turn signals by yourself?
(0: do not upload >0: upload one data package at an interval) (0: do not upload >0: upload one data package at an interval) (0: no alarm 1: 1 meter to alarm 2: 2 meters to alarm 3: 3 meters to alarm 4: 4 meters to alarm 5: 5 meters to alarm) （unit：0. 1s） (0: no alarm 1: 4 meters to alarm 2: 5 meters to alarm 3: 6 meters to alarm 4: 7 meters to alarm 5: 8 meters to alarm) (0: only once 1: at interval) (0: by distance 1: alarm immediately) (0: no output 1: output by 485 bus 2: output by APP 3: output by 485 bus and APP） (0: no output 1: output by 485 bus 2: output by APP 3: output by 485 bus and APP） data card ID Illegal file connecting

Preparation Park your car on LEVEL ground. The skyline must be visible from inside the car. Park your car on LEVEL ground. Leave at least four meters in front of the vehicle. There must be no obstacles in front of vehicle.
As above: the main unit has a 5-pin plug to connect with one of 5-pin plugs on buzzer. As above: the buzzer has two 5-pin plugs (to connect with the main unit and the OBD box) and one connector (to connect vibration cushion) As above: the OBD box has two 5-pin plugs (one to connect with the buzzer, and the other as a backup) and one 4-pin plug (to connect to the ACC of the vehicle) As above (optional): the HUB has four ports as below. 

The Comm-1 port has two 5-pin connectors. You can connect any of them with the buzzer. 
The P&C Interface port has 5 wires The HS Interface port has 6 wires As above (optional): the extension line has two 5-pin plugs at its ends. This line is extend between two 5-pin plug devices. As above(optional): One end of the 4-pin line is a 4-pin plug, while the other end of the line is three wires. As above (optional): the side slot of the GPRS module is for the mobile card. This module supports GPRS of China Mobile. TF card, Anti-glare screen
Power supply: There are two ways to supply power from the vehicle to the ADAS: from the fuse box of the car, or from the OBD box of the car. 
Note:
to link the power wires, the installers must have been trained by Vispect and must hold the certifications required by the local laws. 以下为不同型号产品的取电建议： Attention: Before connecting the wires, please stop the engine and pull out the car key. Second option 2: Supply power from OBD box 1. Connect the 5-pin plug of the main unit with any of the 5-pin plugs of the buzzer

2. Connect the other 5-pin plug of the buzzer with any of the 5-pin plugs of the OBD box. 

3. Insert the OBD box into your car’s OBD interface connector. Except for some “old” cars, most cars have OBD interfaces. The OBD interface is usually nearby the bottom of the steering wheel of the driver’s seat or nearby the bottom of the gearshift. The specific position may be determined by referencing the user manual accompanied with the vehicle. 

• In addition, the space of the OBD interface connector is relatively small. If it is impossible to directly insert the box, it may be changed through the OBD line with one portal. 

• If your OBD connector has already been used, it may be changed through the OBD line with two portals. 
 OBD line with one portal OBD line with two portals (optional) 1. Connect the 4-pin line with the 4-pin plug of the OBD box • The system can be connected to the ACC wire of your car, to know the engine starts or stops. If your vehicle is an electric or hybrid car, or it can automatically turn off its engine after the car has stopped for a while, we strongly suggest you connect your system to the ACC wire of the vehicle. • Attention: On some vehicle models, if your system is not connected to the ACC wire of the car, the system may turn itself on and off improperly. First option 1: Supply power from fuse box 1. Connect the 5-pin plug of the main unit with any of the 5-pin plugs of the buzzer.

2. Connect the other 5-pin plug of the buzzer with any of the 5-pin plugs of the HUB

3. Connect the PWR and GND lines of the HUB with the battery and Ground lines of the vehicle. Make sure the power supply continues even after the car key has been pulled out

• Attention: Do not connect to any fuse that may endanger driving safety, such as the vehicle ignition fuse, vehicle engine fuse, brake fuse, and the steering wheel fuse. 

 Connect the ACC(option)：
 • Before connecting the ACC wire of the car, please check your local laws if you are allowed to do the followings. 
2. The voltages you will measure are 12V for domestic vehicles and 24V for trucks and buses. Set the multimeter to max DC 60V. 

3. Take off the fuse box cover. Most fuse boxes look like the photo below, with wiring instructions.
4. Following the fuse box wiring instructions, find the fuses of the entertainment system or the radio. 

5. Turn the car key to ACC, then measure the voltages of the two socket holes. Pull out the car key, and then measure again the voltages of the two socket holes. One of the holes has no voltage no mater the key is on ACC or is pulled out, and this hole is the one we want. 

6. Wrap our ACC wire around a leg of the fuse. Plug the fuse back into its socket, and let the leg with the ACC wire into the hole that we want. 

7. Pull out the car key. 
 • Attention: Do not connect the ACC wire to any fuse that may endanger driving safety, such as the vehicle ignition fuse, vehicle engine fuse, brake fuse, and the steering wheel fuse. • The system can be connected to the ACC wire of your car, to know the engine starts or stops. If your vehicle is an electric or hybrid car, or it can automatically turn off its engine after the car has stopped for a while, we strongly suggest you connect your system to the ACC wire of the vehicle. • If the icon does not appear on the buzzer, please check as the following:

• Slightly step on the gas pedal, and see if the buzzer lights up. 

• Check if the wires have been connected correctly. 

• Check if the OBD box is plugged tightly into the OBD interface connector of the car. If still unsolved for a V Series system, you need to link your system with the ACC of the car. 

• If still unsolved , you have to change the way to supply power.
Connect the 5-pin plug of the GPRS module to any of the 5-pin plugs of the OBD box or those of the HUB. Insert a cell phone card into the module. 
 Attention: Use the GPRS module only when needed. 
 As above, plug the TF memory card into the Main Unit. Driving videos will be saved in this card. In daily usage, please do NOT plug or remove the memory card when the Main Unit is still working. 
 • The anti-glare screen is designed to prevent light in the vehicle from being reflected onto the camera. In case of light reflection, recognition will be affected. 
• Following the figure below, stick the anti-glare screen onto the small flat under the lens of the main unit. The anti-glare screen should cover the screw holes. 
 • After the anti-glare screen is installed, confirm whether the screen shields the image. If so, the anti-glare screen may be cut a little as is appropriate. 

• However, the anti-glare screen must make contact with the windshield to prevent potential reflectionThe anti-glare screen must be in contact with the windshield.
• Make sure your wiring is right. Insert the car key and start the engine, and then put the car into gear P. Slightly step on the gas pedal. 

• The system is starting automatically. After a while, the buzzer shows an icon. 
If the icon does not appear on the buzzer, please check as the following:

• Slightly step on the gas pedal, and see if the buzzer lights up. 

• Check if the wires have been connected correctly. 

• If the power is from the OBD interface of the car: check if the OBD box is plugged tightly. Also check the ACC wire connection if you have. 
If the power is from the fuse box of the car: check if the power wires of HUB is tightly connected to the power wires of the car, and check if the ACC wires are connected as required. 

• If still unsolved , you have to change the way to supply power.
Your Main Unit will communicate with smart phones by Bluetooth. 

 Bluetooth name VISPECT_ADAS_V1

Initial password：6666 Bluetooth name VISF100000XXX

Initial password：6666 Start to connect
Position of camera and buzzer Attention: Please DO NOT fix the main unit and the buzzer after choosing the places. They will still be moved and will be fixed later. V款和F款：镜头（与主机一体）粘贴在前挡风玻璃上，视野朝向前方；

S款：镜头与主机分体，镜头粘贴在前挡风玻璃上，视野朝向前方；主机一般隐藏在副驾的储物箱里面；
 Attention ： 
• 安装位置示意图： It is recommended to be installed on the dash board for easy checking and listening. 
 1-Main Unit 2-buzzer
 Following the figure below, select the appropriate positions for the devices. 
• The main unit’s view should not be blocked by any obstacle like the windshield wipers. 

• The main unit should be installed within the wiper range. 

• The main unit shall not obstruct the driver’s view, while the area facing the rearview mirror is often selected. 

• For bigger vehicles, including trucks and buses, the main unit should be installed in a lower central position of the front windshield (such as above the center console as recommended). For smaller vehicles, including coupes, sedans, vans , pickups, and SUVs, the camera position shall be placed as high as possible, while the area facing the rearview mirror is often selected:
 • The main unit should be fixed nearby the centerline of the front windshield as close as possible. The main unit centerline should deviate within ±5 cm from the centerline of the front windshield:
 • If there is an anti-glare sensor on the rearview mirror, please keep away from it to prevent the main unit from blocking the sensor. 

• If vehicle film is attached to the front windshield, please install the main unit where the light transmission of the vehicle film is good. 
• Note: this step only selects camera position, do not paste the camera and buzzer! You need to adjust the camera angle before pasting. The next step will be instructed in detail. 
 Position of buzzer: • The buzzer shall be installed in such a place that the driver can access during driving and where the driver easily hears the alarm and sees the alarm icon. It is usually installed above the instrument panel of the driver’s seat. 

• The buzzer can be stuck onto the selected surface with the 3M adhesive tape in this package. 


Video Fix and calibrate Place the calibration board Place the calibration board 3–3. 5 meters ahead the windshield. Keep it at the extension of the centerline of the car. The board needs to be fixed. You can attach it on the wall or the garage door, or hang it on a ladder. The ground must be LEVEL

Board on the wall or garage door Board on a ladder. The board does not need to be vertical. Fix the main unit Paste main unit • Measure height A—adjust the board Use a tape to measure the height from the ground to the camera’s planed position. This height is A. Gently move the board. Let the two ends of its center line (the line in the middle of the number 3 and 4) be at height A. • Adjust the camera level---fix the main unit Before attaching the main unit to the windshield, thoroughly clean the intended spot with alcohol or water and wait for it to dry. 
 There is 3M adhesive tape on the back of the Main Unit. Tear off the cover paper of the tape
 Attention: be careful not to stick the Main Unit onto the windshield. 
 Now, we are going to stick the Main Unit onto the windshield at the intended spot with a proper angle. 
 1. Tap the "start" button at the bottom of this page, you can start to calibrate the system. The real view will be displayed on your phone. In the image, the red line is the dynamic horizontal line. The red cross is the center of the screen, and the blue line is the middle line of the screen. 2. Take the Main Unit to the intended spot. 
 3. Adjust the tilt of the main unit, and slip the small steel tube (the lens regulator) over the small knob on the side of main unit to adjust the lens angle vertically. Let the red line in the image overlap any horizontal line on the calibration board, and let the red cross fall near the vertical centerline of the board; Keep the Main Unit’s angle, gently stick it onto the windshield at the intended spot. 

 Tap the button below to see the camera image. Then you can start the steps introduced above. Fine-turn the camera Slightly adjust camera • Measure height B-- fine-turn the camera 
 Measure and note the camera height B. On calibration board, draw an obvious mark at height B. Slip the small steel tube over the small knob on the side of main unit. Move the tube gently to let the red line overlap the height B mark on the board. Tap the button below to see the camera image. Then you can start the steps introduced above. The calibration is finished. 
 Special Attention: in the future, if you moved the camera, please redo this "fix-calibrate" and the “adapt automatically” parts of this APP. Start
Video • The main unit centerline should deviate within ±5 cm from the centerline of the front windshield. 
• Before attaching the main unit to the windshield, thoroughly clean the intended spot with alcohol or water and wait for it to dry. 
• Tap the "start" button at the bottom of this page, you can start to calibrate the system. The real view will be displayed on your phone. 
The red cross is always in the center point of the image. The red line is the dynamic horizontal line and the blue line is the middle line of the phone's screen. 
• There is a piece of 3M adhesive tape on the back of the Main Unit. Tear off the cover paper of the tape (Attention: be careful not to stick the Main Unit onto the windshield). Gently adjust the right-left angle of main unit, and the red line will rotate. 
 
• When the red line overlaps the blue line as close as possible, stick the main unit onto the windshield at the position you selected. 
• Slip the small steel tube(the lens regulator) over the small knob on the side of main unit. Move the tube gently, and the lens changes its angle vertically. 
• As below, stop when the red line and the blue line overlap the skyline. The calibration is finished. 

Measuring demo Vehicle Vehicle width: Measure the distance between the two wheels of the vehicle. 车宽 Main unit Deviation: measure the distance from host camera to car center(Seen from the front, take the car center as origin, positive at left, negative at right) Height: The distance from the device to the ground (you have measured this before) 偏移 高度 深度：测量主机镜头中心到车头保险杠顶端的距离 深度
说明 Turn off the power supply to the Main Unit : Stop the engine and pull out the car key. The buzzer should turn off in two minutes. Connect the wires: Before this step, you have already connected the power wires. Now other wires need to be connected to the vehicle, to read the speed, the left and right turn signal, the brake, and wiper information from the vehicle. Some information below is optional. Here are various wiring plans as below. • 连线： After selecting your wiring plan, please connect the wires by following the instructions in the "Choose a site - Supply power"— "parts and cables" chapter of this APP. Note: to link the wires, the installers must have been trained by Vispect and must hold the certifications required by the local laws. Turn on the Main Unit： After finishing the wiring, Insert the car key, start the car engine, hang gear P, and slightly step on the gas pedal. Special Attention: in the future, if you moved the camera, please redo the “adapt automatically” part of this APP. Read • 关车、拔掉车钥匙；确认提示器关机； • 连接您需要的线路； • 启动车；挂P档、轻踩油门； • 按以下操作步骤，验证接线效果； Connect to Bluetooth： Connect Verify OBD connection： Note: this operation is only for reading speed from the OBD interface. If you chose to read from the speed line, please skip this step. Hang in the gear N or P. Slightly step on the gas pedal. If the digits below change, it means your connection is correct. If the digits remain the same, you need to check the OBD connection or change to another wiring plan. Read the turn signals from the OBD interface of the car： Note: this operation is only for reading the turn signals from the OBD interface. If you decide to ignore the turn signals, or read the signals from the turn signal lines of the car, please skip this step. Read Verify the L/R turn signals： This step is to check if your system can correctly read the turn signals from the vehicle. If the wiring is correct, the following icons will light when you turn on the turn signals (Attention：there may be a 1~3 seconds delay) Verify other hard wires： If you have connected the braking or wiper wires, please step on the brake or turn on the wiper. If the wiring is correct, the following icon will flash with your operation. Connected
Read the L/R turn signals Press this button to read the turn signals from the OBD interface of the car Note: 
For family cars, this step can be skipped.
Some particular cars block the turn signals at their OBD interface, so we may fail to read their signals. However, we can read the signals of most cars. 
If your ADAS succeeds on reading the turn signals from your car, it will not alarm when you turn on the turn lights and then change the lane.
 If you choose to skip this step, or you fail at this step, the ADAS will not be able to read the turn signals, thus it will alarm whenever you change the lane, no mater you have turned on the turn light or not. Please turn on the turn signal. If the wiring is correct, the following icon will blink with your operation (1~3 seconds delay is normal) Please check if the Main Unit has been connected with your phone
• After finishing wiring, stop the engine and pull out the car key • Fix cables: The cable tie is used to ensure that the cable may not be clamped or clogged by the moving parts on the vehicle. • Two methods are available to conceal the wires and cables - A. The cable may be concealed in the sealing rubber strip of the windshield. B. or may be stuck onto the windshield surface with the fixed fastener if permitted by the owner of the vehicle. Other cables may be concealed, subject to actual conditions. 
 Please note that cables must be kept away from high temperatures and sharp objects, and wiring shall not affect the normal driving and use of the vehicle. After fixing the cables, use the adhesive tape in the package to stick the buzzer onto the selected position. 
 Video
Operating • Adapt the camera angle Tap the button below to adapt the camera angle.
After the button is pressed, the camera will automatically adapt itself when you first time drive fast on road. The adapting usually lasts for three to five minutes. Please try your best to drive in the middle of your own lane during the adapting process. You can see the adapting progress under the ‘live’ mode.
In the future, if you have moved the camera, please redo the "fix-calibrate" and tap the button below again to redo the adapting. Adapt angle • Adapt vehicle speed: Note: If you did not choose to connect your system with the speed wire of the car, please skip this step. Tap the button below to adapt to the car speed wire. In the future, if you have re-connected the speed wire, please tap the button again to redo the adapting. After the button is pressed, the system will automatically adapt to the speed wire when you first time drive fast on road. Adjust vehicle speed Automatic adjusting started Vehicle speed adjustment failed

Step/1 Step/2 Step/3 Step/4 Step/5 Step/6 Step/7 Step/8 Step/9 Host Adjustment Click on “Enter”, real scenes and horizontal level will automatically show on your app Adjust your host position to make sure real scenes can completely show on your app without any angle tilt. Slightly adjust the small wheel at bottom left of your host to overlap skyline with the horizontal level in general. The whole host adjustments have been finished. Enter Calibration Deviation & Depth & Height Deviation: measure the distance from host camera to car center(Seen from the front, take the car center as origin, positive at left, negative at right) Depth: measure the distance from host camera to the top of vehicle bumper Height: measure the distance from camera of host to the ground
The V series has more than one model or planned models. The following will introduce the installation and calibration of the model V-1. Equipment Information More Click the “Calibrate” button on the app’s “My Device”- “Installation and Calibration” page. After the smart phone connects with the main unit, the real view of the main unit will be displayed on your smart phone. In the middle of the image, a blue line will appear as below. Then, a red line will also appear. Gently adjust the right-left angle of the main unit, and the red line will rotate. When the red line overlaps the blue line as close as possible, stick the main unit onto the windshield at the position you selected. Rotate gently the angle wheel on the side of the main unit. The lens changes its angle vertically. Stop rotating when the blue line overlaps the skyline as below. The calibration is finished. Height Deviation Depth Conceal the wires Acnti-glare Screen Test
